subject: RE: [junit] Ant & JUnit - using properties

Have a visit to http://ant.apache.org/manual/index.html and look at the
<property> task's file attribute.

<target name="runtests">
  <property file="${test.props}"> <!-- pass the props file as a -D command
line arg if desired -->
[...]

Then on the command line:
ant -Dtest.props=C:/foo/bar.properties runtests

But I suspect that'll get old quick since you mentioned a per-testcase
properties file.  In that case, you might want to scrap the idea of
maintaining this in your Ant script and use the Java Properties API and a
naming convention (a la java.util.PropertyResourceBundle) to dynamically
find a load the TestCase's properties from the TestCases themselves.

Scott S.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vladimir Blagojevic [mailto:vladimir@...]
[...]
> I would like to invoke my unit test from ant and include java style
> properties that are accesible from the Junit test code. For example, the
> file test_case1.properties includes:
>
> user.login=vladimir
> user.pass=junit
> ...
>
> Then invoke ant test target "executetests" with the specified property
> file:
>
> ant executetests test_case1.properties
[...]
